trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of early mobility in patients after Total Knee Replacement on hospital length of stay,pain and function: A randomised control trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of early mobility in patients after Total Knee Replacement on hospital length of stay, pain and function: A randomised control trial

interventions.interventions: Patients after Total Knee Replacement were mobilised within first 4-6hrs. This involves getting these patients out of bed and mobilising a short distance and then sitting them out in a chair for a short period of time, to see if their recovery is faster than our current protocol
interventions.comparator: The control is the current protocol of mobilising patients within the 24hrs

primaryOutcome.outcome: Lenght of hospital stay for these patients in number of days
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of discharge from the acute ward
before surgery, on discharge from the ward and 6wks after the surgery

primaryOutcome.outcome: knee range of motion measured in degrees using a goniometer
primaryOutcome.timepoint: before surgery, on discharge from the ward and 6wks post surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Time taken in seconds for the patient to perform a Timed Up and Go test (getting up from a chair, walking 3m andsitting back down on the chair)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: before surgery, on discharge from the ward and 6wks post surgery

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: patients under the age of 80 and over the age of 40, with no major cardiovascular or repiratory diseases and no diabetes, patients with OA who is having a primary Total Knee Replacement
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: patients aged over 80, with known cardiovascular, respiratory diseases and diabetes

trial_design.concealment: patients were seen at the preadmission clinic prior tho the surgery, eligible patients were given detailed information about the study, writtern consent signed by them. Then they were asked a pick a number from the hat with numbers 1 and 2 . I allocated to the control group and 2 allocated to the experiment al group
trial_design.sequence: picking a number from the hat

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Hospital Road, Conord Hospital, Concord 2137 Australia NSW

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Hospital Rd, Concord hospital Concord 2137 Australia NSW

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Trial aimed at determining whether mobilising patients after Total Knee Replacement within the first 4-6hrs after surgery compared to mobilising within the 24 hrs after surgery changes the outcome for these patients

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Hospital Rd, Concord Hospital, Concord 2137 Asutralia NSW
